body.name: Graco® DreamMore™ 3-in-1 Portable Bassinet & Travel Crib, Beau

features: 3 modes of use: Bedside bassinet, portable bassinet, and toddler playard
The bassinet quickly removes from the legs for increased portability, providing a safe sleep space in any room of your home
Spacious playard for toddlers provides more space for your little one to sleep and has a zipper door for when it's time to play
Bassinet folds flat in one step, and the included carry bag makes travel and storage convenient
Bassinet includes 2-speed vibration to soothe baby
body.description: The Graco® DreamMore™ 3-in-1 Portable Bassinet & Travel Crib offers three modes of use and grows with your baby from newborn to infant to toddler. This bassinet can be used bedside, around the home, or on the go! The full-size bassinet can transition for portable use and the integrated carry handles make it easy to bring baby with you around the home. Plus, the one-step, compact fold makes storage and traveling a breeze. The baby bassinet conveniently transitions into a spacious, toddler playard with a zippered activity door, while its airy mesh sides help keep your child in sight as they sleep or play. The DreamMore™ 3-in-1 also features 2-speed vibration to help soothe baby, a machine-washable mattress pad cover, and a canopy to shield baby from light. The bassinet also includes a carry bag for visits away from home. Whether at home or away, the Graco® DreamMore™ 3-in-1 Portable Bassinet & Travel Crib provides a cozy sleep space for your baby or toddler.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Highlights you will love: Position baby bedside at your eye levelGrows with your child, converting to a toddler The simple look blends seamlessly into your homeGrows with your baby, converting to a toddler playard Graco DreamMore 3-in-1 Portable Bassinet & Travel Crib The Graco DreamMore 3-in-1 Portable Bassinet & Travel Crib offers 3 modes of use as a bedside bassinet, portable bassinet, and toddler playard. The full-size bassinet can transition for portable use and the one-step, compact fold makes storage and traveling a breeze. The baby bassinet conveniently transitions into a spacious toddler playard with a zippered activity door.

For Home and Away 3-in-1 Bassinet Can be used as a bedside bassinet, portable bassinet, and toddler playard. Grows with Your Child Toddler playard mode offers your growing child more space to sleep and has a zippered door for when it's time to play. Increased Portability The bassinet quickly removes from the legs, allowing you to safely move baby around the home. One-Step Fold Bassinet folds flat with an easy, one-step fold and includes a convenient carry bag, making travel and storage simple.

More to Love 2-Speed Vibration Bassinet includes 2-speed vibration settings to help soothe baby. Hassle-Free Assembly Setup takes seconds with a one-step unfold and snap-on legs. Machine-Washable Mattress Cover Mattress pad comes with a machine-washable cover for quick and convenient cleaning. Airy Mesh Sides Mesh sides allow maximum airflow for baby's comfort and increased visibility.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Keeps baby close, easy to see baby and easy to get too!The baby can even sway themselves when they move/wiggle around, instead of me manually swaying it with the handle. You can even remove the bassinet and bring to a different room, which we've only done once but it did make things easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this bassinet!
reviews.reviewText: My baby sleeps in this bassinet every night and she loves it! I love that I can reach her easily!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s ok… one of the worst feature is how LOUD the click is when you switch form stationary to sway ability. It’s unnecessary for it to be that loud. It wakes the baby up every time. Then also the mesh isn’t that see through, and there are no crib sheets to fit the mattress so you have to wash it if the baby spits up, which means you can’t use the bassinet unless you’re all over your laundry. With a newborn it’s kind of a pain.

reviews.reviewerName: Steel City Adventure CatsSteel City Adventure Cats
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Keep baby close! Great for taller beds
reviews.reviewText: Let me start by saying that we really love this bassinet now that it’s put together, and are very pleased with our purchase. But assembly wasn’t super fun.How to stress out a 38 week pregnant lady: have her put this together. I typically let my husband put things together, but had a bout of nesting and wanted it together immediately, so I did it myself while he was working. I didn’t find some of the instructions to be super clear. For example, I couldn’t tell exactly where they wanted the side brackets to go- and after inserting them, I realized they weren’t thread through the fabric pockets (because the instructions didn’t make it known how important that was). Getting them unsnapped took all of my body weight (which is a lot right now) as well as jamming a screwdriver into the side to get the little plastic hooks to unlatch. It made me very angry.Another point of frustration was that one of the “feet” didn’t arrive with its white plastic bottom/stoppers attached, it was floating freely in the box, and it was very hard to jam into the metal.My husband helped me with the last few steps, and we were so pleasantly surprised at how nicely it glides under our bed and rests on top, without even being on the highest setting. We have a sleepnumber bed that sits a bit higher, so although I measured before ordering, I was still worried that somehow this wouldn’t be tall enough- but it definitely is, and then some!I like that baby will be super close to us in bed, and my husband likes that he will be able to easily look over and see baby too. We actually had a bassinet before this one (the beside me Wink) that we were planning to use (sat very low, didn’t go over the bed, didn’t have the swaying feature like this does) but when we saw this we knew it would work so much better for us!The swaying feature works great, though you do have to unlock it from the back, which would be a little annoying to do if you’re laying in bed and want to sway baby in the middle of the night. It’d be nice if this lock was accessible from the front somehow. The bassinet also very easily lifts up and off of the base with the use of the side handles, so if you want to lift baby and take them to another room, that would be very convenient to do!Lastly, the mattress pad is very thin and easy to pull off (just Velcro) so you could toss this in the wash very easily. However, I wish that you could buy extra pads or that a bassinet sheet worked with this (it doesn't) so that you could switch out the sheet while washing.All in all, we are happy with this and I think it will be convenient for us as first time parents once we bring our newborn home!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great rocking feature
reviews.reviewText: my baby loves this the padding is comfortable as well as firm and washable. great rocking feature for when baby gets fussy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Me and baby love it
reviews.reviewText: Of course my son loves to sleep in the bed with me but he takes his naps in his bassinet. I do have a boppy pillow in it so it’s more comfortable. I love that it has a handle so I can pull it close to the bed without having to get up. I also love how it swings so when I go to lay him down, if he wakes up the swinging will put him back to sleep. I would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Great potential, but in the end the “mattress” is too awful
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to love this bassinet. There are so many great features. It’s aesthetically pleasing, and loved the grid base that the mattress sits on. The one major design flaw- and the reason I am returning is the mattress. I asked how thick the mattress was and received no response so I ordered it to see. It is extremely thin— only .5 inch. The material it is made out of is low density so if you press down on it, you can feel the base (and the grid part of it) through the mattress. I have a hard time believing it would be comfortable for a baby. I do realize that babies need firm surfaces, but this would be like laying on a hard floor. I compared it to my old bassinet (Halo) mattress which is just a pretty standard ~1” poly foam mattress (and really isn’t the best), and even if felt way better than this one. On top of all that, there are no sheets you can purchase for it, and you can’t buy a replacement so that you have an extra if baby spits up or has a blow out??? What is baby supposed to sleep on while you wait for it to hang dry? Anyways, I felt like there was so much potential with this bassinet, and perhaps the company will redesign with a better mattress! I would love to see it with a breathable mattress like the Halo Dreamweave or Newton style mattress.
